{"step_by_step_thinking": "The sternal body is a part of the sternum, which is a long, flat bone located in the center of the chest. It connects to the ribs via cartilage and forms the front of the rib cage, thus helping to protect the heart, lungs, and major blood vessels from injury. The fusion of the lower two parts of the sternal body typically occurs during adolescence, which is around the age of 14 years.", "answer_choice": "D. 14 years"}
